user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_queue_auth_fail_response:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_queue_auth_fail_response (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                              const char *realm,
                              const char *opaque,
                              struct MHD_Response *response,
                              int signal_stale)
{
  return MHD_queue_auth_fail_response2 (connection,
                                        realm,
                                        opaque,
                                        response,
                                        signal_stale,
                                        MHD_DIGEST_ALG_MD5);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_queue_auth_fail_response:
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_queue_auth_fail_response2 (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                               const char *realm,
                               const char *opaque,
                               struct MHD_Response *response,
                               int signal_stale,
                               enum MHD_DigestAuthAlgorithm algo)
{
  enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiAlgo3 algo3;

  if (MHD_DIGEST_ALG_MD5 == algo)
    algo3 = MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_ALGO3_MD5;
  else if (MHD_DIGEST_ALG_SHA256 == algo)
    algo3 = MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_ALGO3_SHA256;
  else if (MHD_DIGEST_ALG_AUTO == algo)
    algo3 = MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_ALGO3_ANY_NON_SESSION;
  else
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("Wrong algo value.\n")); /* API violation! */

  return MHD_queue_auth_required_response3 (connection, realm, opaque,
                                            NULL, response, signal_stale,
                                            MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_QOP_AUTH,
                                            algo3,
                                            0, 0);
}
...
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_queue_auth_required_response3 (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                                   const char *realm,
                                   const char *opaque,
                                   const char *domain,
                                   struct MHD_Response *response,
                                   int signal_stale,
                                   enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiQOP mqop,
                                   enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiAlgo3 malgo3,
                                   int userhash_support,
                                   int prefer_utf8)
{
  struct DigestAlgorithm da;
  char *buf_ptr;
  enum MHD_Result ret;

  buf_ptr = NULL;
  digest_setup_zero (&da);
  ret = queue_auth_required_response3_inner (connection,
                                             realm,
                                             opaque,
                                             domain,
                                             response,
                                             signal_stale,
                                             mqop,
                                             malgo3,
                                             userhash_support,
                                             prefer_utf8,
                                             &buf_ptr,
                                             &da);
  digest_deinit (&da);
  if (NULL != buf_ptr)
    free (buf_ptr);
  return ret;
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The three listed function bodies form the visible call chain in the provided code and therefore must be inspected for indirect recursion: MHD_queue_auth_fail_response -> MHD_queue_auth_fail_response2 -> MHD_queue_auth_required_response3 -> queue_auth_required_response3_inner. No direct self-calls appear in the shown fragments. The remaining calls inside these fragments (digest_setup_zero, digest_deinit, free, MHD_PANIC) are simple helpers or error handlers and, based on the provided code, do not call back into the shown functions; thus they are not flagged here. The implementation of queue_auth_required_response3_inner (not provided) and any functions it calls should be inspected by the investigators for possible indirect recursion back into any of the above functions.
